Articles.Content:
alright, so i have a space station, just a normal one, like the iss, in an equatorial (or whatever you call those orbits that go on the equator with little to no inclination) orbit with a periapsis and apoapsis of 1,000,200-1,000,800 ish and i want you, yes, you to make an ssto thats easy to fly and can deliver enough liquid fuel, oxidizer, and monoprop for the launch to even be worth the time and effort, maybe around 3/4 of the orange tank (2.5m) from rockomax). also, i want that to be able to deorbit without refuelling (or else the mission would be pointless). another also, if the ssto is not crewed (controlled with a `probe core or somethin) then it doesnt need to survive reentry, just as long as it deorbits. it can be as expensive as you want, but i dont wanna see a bunch of rtgs in one place making the thing 10 billion dollars more expensive than necessary. oh, and stock only pls in 1.3.1

 

now whats in it for you you ask? well, nothin, but if you dont want to make an ssto for me, then dont.

i know the way i speak is rude, and forgive me. im too lazy.

THANK YOU for all who would help! 

PS i dont think theres room for any unnecessary bumps near where the docking port is coz my layout is noob.

pls bear with my manners sorry

THANKSSS

Edited November 2, 2017 by Nightguard

You could use my Róta SSTO.  It was designed to carry a full big orange tank to an 80km orbit, and it has exceeded it's design intent, carrying roughly 40 tons to a 100km orbit.  It is probe controlled and is fully capable of landing back on the runway.

KerbaX link

6 hours ago, Thor Wotansen said:

You could use my Róta SSTO.  It was designed to carry a full big orange tank to an 80km orbit, and it has exceeded it's design intent, carrying roughly 40 tons to a 100km orbit.  It is probe controlled and is fully capable of landing back on the runway.

KerbaX link

thanks! i'll check it out.
